title: Hong Kong Residents Bemoan Toughest Pandemic Curbs Yet: ‘It’s Like Living in 2020’
sub_head: Businesses warn of dire consequences from shutdowns, as the city limits household gatherings and discloses a record 1,325 cases on Friday
body:
HONG KONG–More than two years after the first coronavirus case arrived in the city, residents are chafing at life under the toughest restrictions since the pandemic began, while much of the world is starting to move on.
“It feels like we’re living in 2020,” said Jessica Chan, a 39-year-old beautician who has seen her earnings, and savings plummet after the government ordered all beauty parlors shut in early January.
